name: Pedro Lemos
body:
![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21270647/18029180/a07f8c2e-6c67-11e6-8ca2-7c63271ec1b9.png)

### About me
I hold a Ph.D. in Philosophy (CLE-UNICAMP).



### Drafts
* [_The Fading Light of Contingency: On Tense, Modals, and Assessment-sensitivity_](https://github.com/pmflemos/pmflemos.github.io/files/440895/CONCISE.FADING.pdf). Ph.D. Thesis.

* _Indicative Conditionals and Relative-truth_.

* [_A Turing Machine for Exponential Function_](philpapers.org/archive/LEMATM.pdf).

* _Report on_ Epstein, R. (2014): Reflections on temporal and modal logic.

* _Supertruth-makers_.

* _Where is non-classicality in a theory of meaning?_.


### Talks

* Conditionals, Retrospective Judgments, and Relative-truth.

  Ninth Principia International Symposium: Possible Worlds and their Applications in Philosophy and the Sciences, 2015, Florian√≥polis. Ninth Principia International Symposium: Possible Worlds and their Applications in Philosophy and the Sciences, 2015.


### Awards

* 'Nota 10 Fellowship', 2009

  One-year fellowship awarded annually by FAPERJ (Rio de Janeiro State funding agency), to a Ph.D./M.A student enrolled in a graduate program ranked 5 or above by CAPES (Brazilian national funding agency)

* USD4.17 awarded for a full description of a single-tape Turing Machine which computes the exponentiation function f(x,y)=x^y (Cf. Epstein, R. & Carnielli, W. (2008): Computability. Computable Functions Logic and the Foundations of Math (Wadsworth & Brooks/Cole Mathematics Series), p.82)


### Miscellaneous
